title: Hair-Pulling Fight Breaks Out In Mexico City Congress | 10 News
description: Lawmakers in Mexico descended into a violent scuffle on Monday night during a debate on transparency reform in Mexico City Congress.  Mexico City's transparency institute is being dissolved, but the Opposition accused the Government of not respecting an agreement to make a new oversight body tripartite (involving three parties).  Members of the Opposition then took the congressional podium in protest, where everyone began shoving, yelling and pulling each other’s hair.  The session was temporarily suspended. When lawmakers returned, Opposition walked out and the Government approved reforms in their absence. title: Bondi Beach Shooting: ISIS Flags Found | 10 News
description: NSW Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon has revealed that IEDs and two homemade ISIS flags have been found in the vehicle registered to one of the shooters behind the Bondi Beach terror attack in Sydney.  Commissioner Lanyon, in a press conference, confirmed that father-son gunmen Naveed and Sajid Akram travelled to the Philippines last month, but the purpose of that visit is under investigation. That comes after a senior counterterrorism official told the ABC that the pair underwent military-style training in the country.  Moreover, authorities corrected the record and said Sajid Akram, the 50-year-old male, has had a firearms licence since 2023 - not 2015 as previously thought. Akram applied for a licence in 2015, but it lapsed as a photograph had not been provided. title: Four Arrested After FBI Foils Alleged NYE Terror Bomb Plot In California | 10 News
description: Four people have been arrested in California, charged with plotting a series of bombing attacks for New Year's Eve.  The coordinated bombings targeted multiple locations across Los Angeles, as well as plans to target ICE agents and vehicles. description: A mountain of floral tributes is still building at Bondi Beach where mourners gather. A shattered community coming together in deep grief. title: Bondi Shooting Gunman Naveed Akram Out Of Coma In Hospital | 10 News
description: It is believed the younger gunman in the massacre is out of a coma. The search for the motive and the methods of the killers has now extended overseas. Police are investigating a trip the pair made just weeks ago to the Philippines. title: Three Children Remain In Hospital After Horror Crash That Killed Four Others | 10 News
description: Three children remain in hospital tonight fighting to recover from injuries after a crash that killed four adults, just south of the New South Wales border, at Muckatah. Investigators are still trying to determine why their minivan didn't brake before leaving the road and slamming into a tree. title: Bondi Shooting: Man Who Threw Bricks At Gunman Before Being Shot Dead Hailed A Hero | 10 News+
description: A second man is being recognised for his heroism following the shooting at Bondi Beach on Sunday. Reuven Morrison threw bricks at one of the gunmen, chased him before being shot, and bled out while waiting for help. Meanwhile, the grandparents of 10-year-old Matilda attended a vigil today. title: Former Forensic Firearms Detective Gives Expert Opinion On Bondi Shooting Aftermath | 10 News+
description: 10 News+ speaks to former forensic firearms detective Gerard Dutton, who was responsible for collecting ballistics evidence after the Port Arthur massacre. We find out exactly what authorities can learn from the six weapons seized from the Bondi massacre and what forensic police and ballistic experts are looking for at the crime scene. title: Hollywood Director Rob Reiner’s Son Charged With Murder Over The Death Of His Parents | 10 News+
description: Rob Reiner, the Hollywood director known for his famously big heart and knack for storytelling, and his wife Michele, were found stabbed to death in their home on Sunday. Their 32-year-old son, Nick, has since been charged with their murders. title: Meet The Miracle Baby Who Was Born During Cyclone Fina | 10 News
description: Little Leilani is a miracle baby who was born in the middle of a natural disaster. When Cyclone Fina first hit Darwin, her mother, Ruby, went into labour on a remote island off Arnhem Land. A rescue jet rushed to their aid to take them to Townsville as Ruby’s contractions continued. Born the next day, Leilani has been nicknamed “Fina” by nurses. title: Bondi Beach Shooting : Gunmen Inspired By Islamic State, Heroes Names Revealed | 10 News
description: Boris and Sofia Gurman have been identified as the couple who bravely tried to stop the Bondi massacre before it began. They were killed in the process, and tonight are being remembered by their family as “people who instinctively and selflessly tried to help others”.  We also know more about the gunmen, including that they travelled to the Philippines just months ago, and were inspired by Islamic state ideology. title: Latest On The Bondi Beach Shooting, Rob Reiner Remembered, Ukraine Peace Plan | 10’s Late News
description: Tonight on 10’s Late News – the latest on the Bondi Beach shooting, more of the victims and the heroes who selflessly tried to stop the gunmen have been identified, and what the police know about the men who carried out this atrocity.  Hollywood remembers director Rob Reiner and his wife Michele after they were murdered in their Los Angeles home, with their son accused of killing them.  The US says they’re willing to provide Ukraine with a NATO-like security guarantee as part of ongoing peace negotiations.
